questions.text: All the following statins should be taken in the evening for the maximal effect on hepatic cholesterol synthesis except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Atorvastatin

Highyeild:

Because HMG¬CoA reductase activity is maximal at midnight, all statins are administered at bedtime to obtain maximum effectiveness. However, this is not necessary for atorvastatin and rosuvastatin, which have long plasma t½. The LDL¬CH lowering potency and efficacy is almost similar to lovastatin. An additional action of a decrease in plasma fibrinogen level has been observed. questions.text: When statins are administered with niacin, the myopathy probably is caused by?

options.label: B
options.text: Enhanced inhibition of skeletal muscle ubiquitin pathway

questions.correct_answer: B. Enhanced inhibition of skeletal muscle ubiquitin pathway
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Enhanced inhibition of skeletal muscle ubiquitin pathway Myopathy occurs when statins are administered with niacin

Highyeild:

Muscle aches are the commonest (10%) side effect of statins. A rise in CPK levels occurs infrequently. Myopathy is the only serious reaction but is rare (< 1 per 1000). Few fatalities due to rhabdomyolysis are on record. Myopathy and liver injury are more common when nicotinic acid/gemfibrozil or CYP3A4 inhibitor—ketoconazole/ erythromycin/cyclosporine/HIV protease inhibitor is given concurrently. Gemfibrozil inhibits the hepatic uptake of statins by the organic anion transporter OATP2 and should not be given with them. Fenofibrate interferes the least with statin uptake/metabolism and should be preferred for combining with them When statins are administered with niacin, the myopathy probably is caused by an enhanced inhibition of the skeletal muscle ubiquitin pathway (a Pharmacodynamic interaction) In 2016, the FDA withdrew approval for statin drug combinations containing fibrates or niacin The risk of myopathy due to statins is increased with niacin

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Very rarely, statins can cause life-threatening muscle damage called rhabdomyolysis. Rhabdomyolysis can cause severe muscle pain, liver damage, kidney failure, and death. The risk of very serious side effects is extremely low and calculated in a few cases per million people taking statins. Option: B. mechanism by which statin treatment can make skeletal muscles susceptible to myopathy—dissociation of the FK506 binding protein (FKBP12) from the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR) Ca 2+ release channel, the ryanodine receptor 1 (RyR1), which is accompanied by numerous spontaneous Ca 2+ release events Option: C. The interaction with simvastatin seems mainly driven by CYP3A4 inhibition at the intestinal level, whereas the interaction with atorvastatin is more due to hepatic CYP3A4 inhibition. The interaction of CYP3A4 inhibitor with simvastatin has been more pronounced compared with atorvastatin

questions.text: The Statin of choice in severe renal dysfunction patients is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Atorvastatin This is a high efficacy and one of the most commonly used statins capable of lowering LDL¬CH. At this dose, a greater reduction in TGs is noted if the same was raised at baseline. Atorvastatin has a much longer plasma t½ of 14–18 hr and has additional antioxidant properties. Statin of choice for patients with severe renal dysfunction as it does not require dose adjustment. In liver disease, Rosuvastatin is preferred

questions.text: Statin causing maximum reduction of LDL is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Rosuvastatin Rosuvastatin belongs to a group of medicines called statins. It is used to lower cholesterol and to reduce the risk of heart disease. Cholesterol is a fatty substance that builds up in your blood vessels and causes narrowing, which may lead to a heart attack or stroke. Statin causing maximum reduction of LDL (51-55% is Rosuvastatin (20mg & 40mg) and atorvastatin

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient was admitted to the hospital with features of muscle pain, fatigue, and dark-colored urine after a general physician started him on medication for his sore throat. He was taking tenololtin for hyperlipidemia and atenolol for hypertension. Lab investigations showed urine dipstick positive for blood but no RBCs in urine microscopy. His serum creatine kinase enzyme is raised. What medication was added by the general physician?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Erythromycin

Highyeild:

Atorvastatin-induced myopathy: This is a case of atorvastatin-induced myopathy and rhabdomyolysis, presenting with myoglobinuria and raised CPK levels Muscle aches are the commonest (10%) side effect. A rise in CPK levels occurs infrequently. Myopathy is the only serious reaction but is rare (< 1 per 1000). Few fatalities due to rhabdomyolysis are on record. Myopathy and liver injury are more common when nicotinic acid/ gemfibrozil or CYP3A4 inhibitor—ketoconazole/erythroid my cin/cyclosporine/HIV protease inhibitor is given concurrently. So the correct answer is erythromycin

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs is most likely to cause impaired glucose tolerance?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Nicotinic acid

Highyeild:

Nicotinic acid (niacin) Nicotinic acid inhibits intracellular lipolysis by lipases in adipocytes and decreases the flow of free fatty acids (FFAs) from adipose tissue to the liver. This reduces the availability of FFAs for the production of TGs and VLDL in the liver. Direct inhibition of hepatocyte TG synthesis is also possible. Indirectly, the VLDL degradation products IDL and LDL are also reduced, but no direct effect on CH and bile acid metabolism has been found. In patients with diabetes mellitus, niacin should be used cautiously because niacin-induced insulin resistance can cause severe hyperglycemia
